gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui
Class View

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewProvider, LockObserver, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExpressionsViewManifestation, FeedView
public abstract class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements ViewProvider, LockObserver

Implements a skeleton of a view. Component developers should derive from this class to implement their own view manifestation classes.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

View

public View()
Creates a new view manifestation with no parent view role. This constructor should be followed by a call to setInfo(ViewInfo). This constructor should be used internally only.

getControlManifestation

public final javax.swing.JComponent getControlManifestation()
A view manifestation may be associated with a control manifestation, which contains GUI controls that can manipulate the view manifestation. The control manifestation will appear in the control area, which is placed above the view manifestation. The control area is not initially visible until the user clicks on the twistie (triangle) located in the title bar or a tab.

Returns:
the control manifestation which is a JComponent; if no control manifestation is necessary for the view, then the method returns null. If there is a control manifestation available, then the method calls executes the PolicyInfo.CategoryType.SHOW_HIDE_CTRL_MANIFESTATION policy category to check if the control manifestation should be available, i.e, if the twistie should be visible.

getStatusWidgets

public java.util.List<? extends javax.swing.JComponent> getStatusWidgets()
Provides a list of widgets to be displayed in the status area of a window, canvas panel, and an inspector area.

Returns:
the list of status widgets provided bu this manifestation

isContentOwner

public boolean isContentOwner()
Determines if this view owns the content. For example, the content of a canvas view contains panels, and the canvas view owns the settings for each panel. This makes the canvas view a content owner. In the MCT UI, a content owner must provide its own inspector view, which gets populated in the right pane of a window, when its content is being inspected.

Returns:
true if the view is a content owner; false otherwise. Returns false by default.

initializeControlManifestation

protected javax.swing.JComponent initializeControlManifestation()
This method must be overridden to create the control manifestation (if any) of this view manifestation.

Returns:
the control manifestation

isLocked

public final boolean isLocked()
Checks if this manifestation is currently locked. A manifestation is not modifiable when locked.

Returns:
true if this manifestation is currently locked; false otherwise.

getManifestationPopupMenu

public final javax.swing.JPopupMenu getManifestationPopupMenu()
Calls the MenuManager that returns the JPopupMenu for this manifestation. The manifestations returned from ActionContext.getSelectedManifestations() will be the selected manifestations from the containing housing.

Returns:
the popup menu for the selected manifestations

setRepaintComponentPair

public final void setRepaintComponentPair(javax.swing.JComponent mainPane,
                                          javax.swing.JComponent overlayPane)
If this manifestation uses an overlay layout (i.e., OverlayLayout), it may be desirable for the overlay pane to paint over the pane under it as it repaints itself. This method adds these JComponents to the internal RepaintManager to ensure this behavior.

Parameters:
mainPane - the pane under the overlay pane
overlayPane - the overlay pane

the namingContext

Sets the naming context for this view.

Parameters:
namingContext - the namingContext to set

handleNamingContextChange

protected void handleNamingContextChange()
This method is invoked when the naming context is changed. The implementing view should adjust the labels in response to an invocation of this method. The default implementation of this method does nothing.

public ViewInfo getInfo()
Gets the info used to create this view.

the type info used to create this view.

Parameters:
isStale - true if view is stale; false otherwise.
